intro: Lepidium armoracium subsp. abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian cress, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its small, edible leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. This subspecies is valued for its nutritional content and has been used in traditional medicine and cuisine.
